title: Introduce the Axiom of Power Sets

blocks.name: ax-pow
blocks.content: Axiom of Power Sets. An axiom of Zermelo-Fraenkel set theory. It states that a set ` y ` exists that includes the power set of a given set ` x ` i.e. contains every subset of ` x ` . The variant ~ axpow2 uses explicit subset notation. A version using class notation is ~ pwex . (Contributed by NM, 21-Jun-1993.)
blocks.origin:
axiom ax-pow(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, setvar s3) {
  |- wex(s0, wal(s1, wi(wal(s2, wi(wcel(cv(s2), cv(s1)), wcel(cv(s2), cv(s3)))), wcel(cv(s1), cv(s0)))))
  -| diffss(s2, s3)
  -| diffss(s0, s2)
  -| diffss(s1, s2)
  -| diffss(s0, s3)
  -| diffss(s1, s3)
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
}
blocks.pretty:
axiom ax-pow(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, setvar s3) {
  âŠ¢ âˆƒ(s0, âˆ€(s1,(âˆ€(s2,(s2 âˆˆ s1 â†’ s2 âˆˆ s3))â†’ s1 âˆˆ s0)))
  âŠ£ d(s2, s3)
  âŠ£ d(s0, s2)
  âŠ£ d(s1, s2)
  âŠ£ d(s0, s3)
  âŠ£ d(s1, s3)
  âŠ£ d(s0, s1)
}

blocks.name: zfpow
blocks.content: Axiom of Power Sets expressed with the fewest number of different variables. (Contributed by NM, 14-Aug-2003.)
blocks.origin:
thm zfpow(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2) {
  |- wex(s0, wal(s1, wi(wal(s0, wi(wcel(cv(s0), cv(s1)), wcel(cv(s0), cv(s2)))), wcel(cv(s1), cv(s0)))))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffss(s0, s2)
  -| diffss(s1, s2)
} = {
  mpbi(wex(s0, wal(s1, wi(wal(s0, wi(wcel(cv(s0), cv(s1)), wcel(cv(s0), cv(s2)))), wcel(cv(s1), cv(s0))))), wex(s0, wal(s1, wi(wal(hs0, wi(wcel(cv(hs0), cv(s1)), wcel(cv(hs0), cv(s2)))), wcel(cv(s1), cv(s0))))))
  ax-pow(s0, s1, hs0, s2)
  exbii(s0, wal(s1, wi(wal(hs0, wi(wcel(cv(hs0), cv(s1)), wcel(cv(hs0), cv(s2)))), wcel(cv(s1), cv(s0)))), wal(s1, wi(wal(s0, wi(wcel(cv(s0), cv(s1)), wcel(cv(s0), cv(s2)))), wcel(cv(s1), cv(s0)))))
  albii(s1, wi(wal(hs0, wi(wcel(cv(hs0), cv(s1)), wcel(cv(hs0), cv(s2)))), wcel(cv(s1), cv(s0))), wi(wal(s0, wi(wcel(cv(s0), cv(s1)), wcel(cv(s0), cv(s2)))), wcel(cv(s1), cv(s0))))
  imbi1i(wal(hs0, wi(wcel(cv(hs0), cv(s1)), wcel(cv(hs0), cv(s2)))), wcel(cv(s1), cv(s0)), wal(s0, wi(wcel(cv(s0), cv(s1)), wcel(cv(s0), cv(s2)))))
  cbvalvw(hs0, s0, wi(wcel(cv(hs0), cv(s1)), wcel(cv(hs0), cv(s2))), wi(wcel(cv(s0), cv(s1)), wcel(cv(s0), cv(s2))))
  imbi12d(wceq(cv(hs0), cv(s0)), wcel(cv(hs0), cv(s1)), wcel(cv(hs0), cv(s2)), wcel(cv(s0), cv(s1)), wcel(cv(s0), cv(s2)))
  elequ1(hs0, s0, s1)
  elequ1(hs0, s0, s2)
  diff.hs0.s(s2)
  diffss.ex(s1, hs0)
  diff.hs0.s(s1)
  diff.hs0.w(wi(wcel(cv(s0), cv(s1)), wcel(cv(s0), cv(s2))))
  diff.wi.s(s0, wcel(cv(hs0), cv(s1)), wcel(cv(hs0), cv(s2)))
  diff.wcel.s(s0, cv(hs0), cv(s1))
  diff.cv.s(s0, s1)
  diff.wcel.s(s0, cv(hs0), cv(s2))
  diff.cv.s(s0, hs0)
  diffss.ex(s0, hs0)
  diff.hs0.s(s0)
  diff.cv.s(s0, s2)
}

thm zfpow(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2) {
  âŠ¢ âˆƒ(s0, âˆ€(s1,(âˆ€(s0,(s0 âˆˆ s1 â†’ s0 âˆˆ s2))â†’ s1 âˆˆ s0)))
  âŠ£ d(s0, s1)
  âŠ£ d(s0, s2)
  âŠ£ d(s1, s2)
} = {
  mpbi(âˆƒ(s0, âˆ€(s1,(âˆ€(s0,(s0 âˆˆ s1 â†’ s0 âˆˆ s2))â†’ s1 âˆˆ s0))), âˆƒ(s0, âˆ€(s1,(âˆ€(hs0,(hs0 âˆˆ s1 â†’ hs0 âˆˆ s2))â†’ s1 âˆˆ s0))))
  ax-pow(s0, s1, hs0, s2)
  exbii(s0, âˆ€(s1,(âˆ€(hs0,(hs0 âˆˆ s1 â†’ hs0 âˆˆ s2))â†’ s1 âˆˆ s0)), âˆ€(s1,(âˆ€(s0,(s0 âˆˆ s1 â†’ s0 âˆˆ s2))â†’ s1 âˆˆ s0)))
  albii(s1, (âˆ€(hs0,(hs0 âˆˆ s1 â†’ hs0 âˆˆ s2))â†’ s1 âˆˆ s0), (âˆ€(s0,(s0 âˆˆ s1 â†’ s0 âˆˆ s2))â†’ s1 âˆˆ s0))
  imbi1i(âˆ€(hs0,(hs0 âˆˆ s1 â†’ hs0 âˆˆ s2)), s1 âˆˆ s0, âˆ€(s0,(s0 âˆˆ s1 â†’ s0 âˆˆ s2)))
  cbvalvw(hs0, s0, (hs0 âˆˆ s1 â†’ hs0 âˆˆ s2), (s0 âˆˆ s1 â†’ s0 âˆˆ s2))
  imbi12d(hs0 = s0, hs0 âˆˆ s1, hs0 âˆˆ s2, s0 âˆˆ s1, s0 âˆˆ s2)
  elequ1(hs0, s0, s1)
  elequ1(hs0, s0, s2)
  diff.hs0.s(s2)
  diffss.ex(s1, hs0)
  diff.hs0.s(s1)
  diff.hs0.w((s0 âˆˆ s1 â†’ s0 âˆˆ s2))
  diff.wi.s(s0, hs0 âˆˆ s1, hs0 âˆˆ s2)
  diff.wcel.s(s0, hs0, s1)
  diff.cv.s(s0, s1)
  diff.wcel.s(s0, hs0, s2)
  diff.cv.s(s0, hs0)
  diffss.ex(s0, hs0)
  diff.hs0.s(s0)
  diff.cv.s(s0, s2)
}

blocks.name: axpow2
blocks.content: A variant of the Axiom of Power Sets ~ ax-pow using subset notation. Problem in [BellMachover] p. 466. (Contributed by NM, 4-Jun-2006.)
blocks.origin:
thm axpow2(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2) {
  |- wex(s0, wal(s1, wi(wss(cv(s1), cv(s2)), wcel(cv(s1), cv(s0)))))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffss(s0, s2)
  -| diffss(s1, s2)
} = {
  mpbir(wex(s0, wal(s1, wi(wss(cv(s1), cv(s2)), wcel(cv(s1), cv(s0))))), wex(s0, wal(s1, wi(wal(hs0, wi(wcel(cv(hs0), cv(s1)), wcel(cv(hs0), cv(s2)))), wcel(cv(s1), cv(s0))))))
  ax-pow(s0, s1, hs0, s2)
  exbii(s0, wal(s1, wi(wss(cv(s1), cv(s2)), wcel(cv(s1), cv(s0)))), wal(s1, wi(wal(hs0, wi(wcel(cv(hs0), cv(s1)), wcel(cv(hs0), cv(s2)))), wcel(cv(s1), cv(s0)))))
  albii(s1, wi(wss(cv(s1), cv(s2)), wcel(cv(s1), cv(s0))), wi(wal(hs0, wi(wcel(cv(hs0), cv(s1)), wcel(cv(hs0), cv(s2)))), wcel(cv(s1), cv(s0))))
  imbi1i(wss(cv(s1), cv(s2)), wcel(cv(s1), cv(s0)), wal(hs0, wi(wcel(cv(hs0), cv(s1)), wcel(cv(hs0), cv(s2)))))
  dfss2(hs0, cv(s1), cv(s2))
  diff.hs0.s(s2)
  diffss.ex(s0, hs0)
  diff.hs0.s(s0)
  diffss.ex(s1, hs0)
  diff.hs0.s(s1)
  diff.hs0.c(cv(s1))
  diff.hs0.c(cv(s2))
}
blocks.pretty:
thm axpow2(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2) {
  âŠ¢ âˆƒ(s0, âˆ€(s1,(s1 âŠ† s2 â†’ s1 âˆˆ s0)))
  âŠ£ d(s0, s1)
  âŠ£ d(s0, s2)
  âŠ£ d(s1, s2)
} = {
  mpbir(âˆƒ(s0, âˆ€(s1,(s1 âŠ† s2 â†’ s1 âˆˆ s0))), âˆƒ(s0, âˆ€(s1,(âˆ€(hs0,(hs0 âˆˆ s1 â†’ hs0 âˆˆ s2))â†’ s1 âˆˆ s0))))
  ax-pow(s0, s1, hs0, s2)
  exbii(s0, âˆ€(s1,(s1 âŠ† s2 â†’ s1 âˆˆ s0)), âˆ€(s1,(âˆ€(hs0,(hs0 âˆˆ s1 â†’ hs0 âˆˆ s2))â†’ s1 âˆˆ s0)))
  albii(s1, (s1 âŠ† s2 â†’ s1 âˆˆ s0), (âˆ€(hs0,(hs0 âˆˆ s1 â†’ hs0 âˆˆ s2))â†’ s1 âˆˆ s0))
  imbi1i(s1 âŠ† s2, s1 âˆˆ s0, âˆ€(hs0,(hs0 âˆˆ s1 â†’ hs0 âˆˆ s2)))
  dfss2(hs0, s1, s2)
  diff.hs0.s(s2)
  diffss.ex(s0, hs0)
  diff.hs0.s(s0)
  diffss.ex(s1, hs0)
  diff.hs0.s(s1)
  diff.hs0.c(s1)
  diff.hs0.c(s2)
}

blocks.name: axpow3
blocks.content: A variant of the Axiom of Power Sets ~ ax-pow . For any set ` x ` , there exists a set ` y ` whose members are exactly the subsets of ` x ` i.e. the power set of ` x ` . Axiom Pow of [BellMachover] p. 466. (Contributed by NM, 4-Jun-2006.)
blocks.origin:
thm axpow3(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2) {
  |- wex(s0, wal(s1, wb(wss(cv(s1), cv(s2)), wcel(cv(s1), cv(s0)))))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffss(s0, s2)
  -| diffss(s1, s2)
} = {
  mpbir(wex(s0, wal(s1, wb(wss(cv(s1), cv(s2)), wcel(cv(s1), cv(s0))))), wex(s0, wal(s1, wb(wcel(cv(s1), cv(s0)), wss(cv(s1), cv(s2))))))
  bm1.3ii(s0, s1, wss(cv(s1), cv(s2)))
  axpow2(s0, s1, s2)
  exbii(s0, wal(s1, wb(wss(cv(s1), cv(s2)), wcel(cv(s1), cv(s0)))), wal(s1, wb(wcel(cv(s1), cv(s0)), wss(cv(s1), cv(s2)))))
  albii(s1, wb(wss(cv(s1), cv(s2)), wcel(cv(s1), cv(s0))), wb(wcel(cv(s1), cv(s0)), wss(cv(s1), cv(s2))))
  bicom(wss(cv(s1), cv(s2)), wcel(cv(s1), cv(s0)))
  diff.wss.s(s0, cv(s1), cv(s2))
  diff.cv.s(s0, s1)
  diff.cv.s(s0, s2)
}
blocks.pretty:
thm axpow3(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2) {
  âŠ¢ âˆƒ(s0, âˆ€(s1,(s1 âŠ† s2 â†” s1 âˆˆ s0)))
  âŠ£ d(s0, s1)
  âŠ£ d(s0, s2)
  âŠ£ d(s1, s2)
} = {
  mpbir(âˆƒ(s0, âˆ€(s1,(s1 âŠ† s2 â†” s1 âˆˆ s0))), âˆƒ(s0, âˆ€(s1,(s1 âˆˆ s0 â†” s1 âŠ† s2))))
  bm1.3ii(s0, s1, s1 âŠ† s2)
  axpow2(s0, s1, s2)
  exbii(s0, âˆ€(s1,(s1 âŠ† s2 â†” s1 âˆˆ s0)), âˆ€(s1,(s1 âˆˆ s0 â†” s1 âŠ† s2)))
  albii(s1, (s1 âŠ† s2 â†” s1 âˆˆ s0), (s1 âˆˆ s0 â†” s1 âŠ† s2))
  bicom(s1 âŠ† s2, s1 âˆˆ s0)
  diff.wss.s(s0, s1, s2)
  diff.cv.s(s0, s1)
  diff.cv.s(s0, s2)
}

blocks.name: el
blocks.content: Every set is an element of some other set. See ~ elALT for a shorter proof using more axioms. (Contributed by NM, 4-Jan-2002.) (Proof shortened by Andrew Salmon, 25-Jul-2011.)
blocks.origin:
thm el(setvar s0, setvar s1) {
  |- wex(s0, wcel(cv(s1), cv(s0)))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
} = {
  eximii(s0, wcel(cv(s1), cv(s0)), wal(hs0, wi(wal(s0, wi(wcel(cv(s0), cv(hs0)), wcel(cv(s0), cv(s1)))), wcel(cv(hs0), cv(s0)))))
  zfpow(s0, hs0, s1)
  spimvw(hs0, s1, wi(wal(s0, wi(wcel(cv(s0), cv(hs0)), wcel(cv(s0), cv(s1)))), wcel(cv(hs0), cv(s0))), wcel(cv(s1), cv(s0)))
  embantd(wceq(cv(hs0), cv(s1)), wal(s0, wi(wcel(cv(s0), cv(hs0)), wcel(cv(s0), cv(s1)))), wcel(cv(hs0), cv(s0)), wcel(cv(s1), cv(s0)))
  alrimiv(s0, wceq(cv(hs0), cv(s1)), wi(wcel(cv(s0), cv(hs0)), wcel(cv(s0), cv(s1))))
  ax9(hs0, s1, s0)
  ax8(hs0, s1, s0)
  diff.hs0.s(s1)
  diff.hs0.w(wcel(cv(s1), cv(s0)))
  diff.wceq.s(s0, cv(hs0), cv(s1))
  diff.cv.s(s0, hs0)
  diffss.ex(s0, hs0)
  diff.hs0.s(s0)
  diff.cv.s(s0, s1)
}
blocks.pretty:
thm el(setvar s0, setvar s1) {
  âŠ¢ âˆƒ(s0, s1 âˆˆ s0)
  âŠ£ d(s0, s1)
} = {
  eximii(s0, s1 âˆˆ s0, âˆ€(hs0,(âˆ€(s0,(s0 âˆˆ hs0 â†’ s0 âˆˆ s1))â†’ hs0 âˆˆ s0)))
  zfpow(s0, hs0, s1)
  spimvw(hs0, s1, (âˆ€(s0,(s0 âˆˆ hs0 â†’ s0 âˆˆ s1))â†’ hs0 âˆˆ s0), s1 âˆˆ s0)
  embantd(hs0 = s1, âˆ€(s0,(s0 âˆˆ hs0 â†’ s0 âˆˆ s1)), hs0 âˆˆ s0, s1 âˆˆ s0)
  alrimiv(s0, hs0 = s1, (s0 âˆˆ hs0 â†’ s0 âˆˆ s1))
  ax9(hs0, s1, s0)
  ax8(hs0, s1, s0)
  diff.hs0.s(s1)
  diff.hs0.w(s1 âˆˆ s0)
  diff.wceq.s(s0, hs0, s1)
  diff.cv.s(s0, hs0)
  diffss.ex(s0, hs0)
  diff.hs0.s(s0)
  diff.cv.s(s0, s1)
}

blocks.name: dtru
blocks.content: At least two sets exist (or in terms of first-order logic, the universe of discourse has two or more objects). Note that we may not substitute the same variable for both ` x ` and ` y ` (as indicated by the distinct variable requirement), for otherwise we would contradict ~ stdpc6 . This theorem is proved directly from set theory axioms (no set theory definitions) and does not use ~ ax-ext or ~ ax-sep . See ~ dtruALT for a shorter proof using these axioms. The proof makes use of dummy variables ` z ` and ` w ` which do not appear in the final theorem. They must be distinct from each other and from ` x ` and ` y ` . In other words, if we were to substitute ` x ` for ` z ` throughout the proof, the proof would fail. (Contributed by NM, 7-Nov-2006.)
blocks.origin:
thm dtru(setvar s0, setvar s1) {
  |- wn(wal(s0, wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1))))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
} = {
  mpbi(wn(wal(s0, wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1)))), wex(s0, wn(wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1)))))
  mp2b(wex(s0, wn(wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1)))), wex(hs0, wex(hs1, wa(wcel(cv(s0), cv(hs0)), wn(wcel(cv(s0), cv(hs1)))))), wex(hs0, wex(hs1, wn(wceq(cv(hs0), cv(hs1))))))
  mpbir2an(wex(hs0, wex(hs1, wa(wcel(cv(s0), cv(hs0)), wn(wcel(cv(s0), cv(hs1)))))), wex(hs0, wcel(cv(s0), cv(hs0))), wex(hs1, wn(wcel(cv(s0), cv(hs1)))))
  el(hs0, s0)
  eximii(hs1, wn(wcel(cv(s0), cv(hs1))), wal(s0, wn(wcel(cv(s0), cv(hs1)))))
  ax-nul(hs1, s0)
  sp(s0, wn(wcel(cv(s0), cv(hs1))))
  exdistrv(hs0, hs1, wcel(cv(s0), cv(hs0)), wn(wcel(cv(s0), cv(hs1))))
  2eximi(hs0, hs1, wa(wcel(cv(s0), cv(hs0)), wn(wcel(cv(s0), cv(hs1)))), wn(wceq(cv(hs0), cv(hs1))))
  con3dimp(wcel(cv(s0), cv(hs0)), wcel(cv(s0), cv(hs1)), wceq(cv(hs0), cv(hs1)))
  com12(wcel(cv(s0), cv(hs0)), wceq(cv(hs0), cv(hs1)), wcel(cv(s0), cv(hs1)))
  ax9(hs0, hs1, s0)
  exlimivv(hs0, hs1, wn(wceq(cv(hs0), cv(hs1))), wex(s0, wn(wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1)))))
  pm2.61i(wi(wn(wceq(cv(hs0), cv(hs1))), wex(s0, wn(wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1))))), wceq(cv(hs1), cv(s1)))
  syl6bi(wceq(cv(hs1), cv(s1)), wn(wceq(cv(hs0), cv(hs1))), wex(s0, wn(wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1)))), wn(wceq(cv(hs0), cv(s1))))
  notbid(wceq(cv(hs1), cv(s1)), wceq(cv(hs0), cv(hs1)), wceq(cv(hs0), cv(s1)))
  equequ2(hs1, s1, hs0)
  spimev(s0, hs0, wn(wceq(cv(hs0), cv(s1))), wn(wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1))))
  con3d(wceq(cv(s0), cv(hs0)), wceq(cv(hs0), cv(s1)), wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1)))
  ax7(s0, hs0, s1)
  a1d(wn(wceq(cv(hs1), cv(s1))), wn(wceq(cv(hs0), cv(hs1))), wex(s0, wn(wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1)))))
  spimev(s0, hs1, wn(wceq(cv(hs1), cv(s1))), wn(wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1))))
  con3d(wceq(cv(s0), cv(hs1)), wceq(cv(hs1), cv(s1)), wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1)))
  ax7(s0, hs1, s1)
  exnal(s0, wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1)))
  diff.hs0.s(hs1)
  diff.hs0.w(wn(wcel(cv(s0), cv(hs1))))
  diff.hs1.w(wcel(cv(s0), cv(hs0)))
  diff.hs0.w(wex(s0, wn(wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1)))))
  diff.hs1.w(wex(s0, wn(wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1)))))
  diff.wn.s(s0, wceq(cv(hs0), cv(s1)))
  diff.wceq.s(s0, cv(hs0), cv(s1))
  diff.cv.s(s0, hs0)
  diffss.ex(s0, hs0)
  diff.hs0.s(s0)
  diff.wn.s(s0, wceq(cv(hs1), cv(s1)))
  diff.wceq.s(s0, cv(hs1), cv(s1))
  diff.cv.s(s0, hs1)
  diffss.ex(s0, hs1)
  diff.hs1.s(s0)
  diff.cv.s(s0, s1)
}

blocks.name: dtrucor
blocks.content: Corollary of ~ dtru . This example illustrates the danger of blindly trusting the standard Deduction Theorem without accounting for free variables: the theorem form of this deduction is not valid, as shown by ~ dtrucor2 . (Contributed by NM, 27-Jun-2002.)

blocks.name: dtrucor2
blocks.content: The theorem form of the deduction ~ dtrucor leads to a contradiction, as mentioned in the "Wrong!" example at ~ mmdeduction.html#bad . (Contributed by NM, 20-Oct-2007.)

blocks.name: dvdemo1
blocks.content: Demonstration of a theorem (scheme) that requires (meta)variables ` x ` and ` y ` to be distinct, but no others. It bundles the theorem schemes ` E. x ( x = y -> x e. x ) ` and ` E. x ( x = y -> y e. x ) ` . Compare ~ dvdemo2 . ("Bundles" is a term introduced by Raph Levien.) (Contributed by NM, 1-Dec-2006.)

blocks.name: dvdemo2
blocks.content: Demonstration of a theorem (scheme) that requires (meta)variables ` x ` and ` z ` to be distinct, but no others. It bundles the theorem schemes ` E. x ( x = x -> z e. x ) ` and ` E. x ( x = y -> y e. x ) ` . Compare ~ dvdemo1 . (Contributed by NM, 1-Dec-2006.)

blocks.name: nfnid
blocks.content: A setvar variable is not free from itself. This theorem is not true in a one-element domain, as illustrated by the use of ~ dtru in its proof. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 8-Oct-2016.)

  bitri(wnf(s0, wcel(cv(hs0), cv(s0))), wal(hs1, wal(hs2, wb(wcel(cv(hs0), cv(hs1)), wcel(cv(hs0), cv(hs2))))), wal(hs1, wal(hs2, wb(wsb(hs1, s0, wcel(cv(hs0), cv(s0))), wsb(hs2, s0, wcel(cv(hs0), cv(s0)))))))

blocks.name: nfcvb
blocks.content: The "distinctor" expression ` -. A. x x = y ` , stating that ` x ` and ` y ` are not the same variable, can be written in terms of ` F/ ` in the obvious way. This theorem is not true in a one-element domain, because then ` F/_ x y ` and ` A. x x = y ` will both be true. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 8-Oct-2016.)

blocks.name: vpwex

}

blocks.name: abssexg
blocks.content: Existence of a class of subsets. (Contributed by NM, 15-Jul-2006.) (Proof shortened by Andrew Salmon, 25-Jul-2011.)

thm abssexg(setvar s0, class c0, class c1, wff w0) {
  |- wi(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(cab(s0, wa(wss(cv(s0), c0), w0)), universe))
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
} = {
  syl(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(cab(s0, wa(wss(cv(s0), c0), w0)), universe), wcel(cpw(c0), universe))
  pwexg(c0, c1)
  sylbi(wcel(cpw(c0), universe), wcel(cab(s0, wa(wss(cv(s0), c0), w0)), universe), wcel(cab(s0, wss(cv(s0), c0)), universe))
  eleq1i(cpw(c0), universe, cab(s0, wss(cv(s0), c0)))
  df-pw(s0, c0)
  mpan(wcel(cab(s0, wss(cv(s0), c0)), universe), wcel(cab(s0, wa(wss(cv(s0), c0), w0)), universe), wss(cab(s0, wa(wss(cv(s0), c0), w0)), cab(s0, wss(cv(s0), c0))))
  ss2abi(s0, wa(wss(cv(s0), c0), w0), wss(cv(s0), c0))
  simpl(wss(cv(s0), c0), w0)
  ssexg(cab(s0, wa(wss(cv(s0), c0), w0)), cab(s0, wss(cv(s0), c0)), universe)
}

blocks.name: dtruALT
blocks.content: Alternate proof of ~ dtru which requires more axioms but is shorter and may be easier to understand. Assuming that ZF set theory is consistent, we cannot prove this theorem unless we specify that ` x ` and ` y ` be distinct. Specifically, theorem ~ spcev requires that ` x ` must not occur in the subexpression ` -. y = { (/) } ` in step 4 nor in the subexpression ` -. y = (/) ` in step 9. The proof verifier will require that ` x ` and ` y ` be in a distinct variable group to ensure this. You can check this by deleting the $d statement in set.mm and rerunning the verifier, which will print a detailed explanation of the distinct variable violation. (Contributed by NM, 15-Jul-1994.) (Proof modification is discouraged.) (New usage is discouraged.)
blocks.origin:
thm dtruALT(setvar s0, setvar s1) {
  |- wn(wal(s0, wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1))))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
} = {
  mpbi(wn(wal(s0, wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1)))), wex(s0, wn(wceq(cv(s1), cv(s0)))))
  pm2.61i(wex(s0, wn(wceq(cv(s1), cv(s0)))), wceq(cv(s1), emptycls))
  syl(wceq(cv(s1), emptycls), wex(s0, wn(wceq(cv(s1), cv(s0)))), wn(wceq(cv(s1), csn(emptycls))))
  0inp0(cv(s1))
  spcev(s0, csn(emptycls), wn(wceq(cv(s1), csn(emptycls))), wn(wceq(cv(s1), cv(s0))))
  p0ex()
  notbid(wceq(cv(s0), csn(emptycls)), wceq(cv(s1), cv(s0)), wceq(cv(s1), csn(emptycls)))
  eqeq2(cv(s0), csn(emptycls), cv(s1))
  spcev(s0, emptycls, wn(wceq(cv(s1), emptycls)), wn(wceq(cv(s1), cv(s0))))
  0ex()
  notbid(wceq(cv(s0), emptycls), wceq(cv(s1), cv(s0)), wceq(cv(s1), emptycls))
  eqeq2(cv(s0), emptycls, cv(s1))
  xchbinx(wex(s0, wn(wceq(cv(s1), cv(s0)))), wal(s0, wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1))), wal(s0, wceq(cv(s1), cv(s0))))
  exnal(s0, wceq(cv(s1), cv(s0)))
  albii(s0, wceq(cv(s1), cv(s0)), wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1)))
  eqcom(cv(s1), cv(s0))
  diff.wn.s(s0, wceq(cv(s1), csn(emptycls)))
  diff.wceq.s(s0, cv(s1), csn(emptycls))
  diff.csn.s(s0, emptycls)
  diff.wn.s(s0, wceq(cv(s1), emptycls))
  diff.wceq.s(s0, cv(s1), emptycls)
  diff.cv.s(s0, s1)
  diff.emptycls.s(s0)
}

blocks.name: axc16b
blocks.content: This theorem shows that axiom ~ ax-c16 is redundant in the presence of theorem ~ dtru , which states simply that at least two things exist. This justifies the remark at ~ mmzfcnd.html#twoness (which links to this theorem). (Proof modification is discouraged.) (New usage is discouraged.) (Contributed by NM, 7-Nov-2006.)

blocks.name: eunex
blocks.content: Existential uniqueness implies there is a value for which the wff argument is false. (Contributed by NM, 24-Oct-2010.) (Proof shortened by BJ, 2-Jan-2023.)
blocks.origin:
thm eunex(setvar s0, wff w0) {
  |- wi(weu(s0, w0), wex(s0, wn(w0)))
} = {
  3imtr4i(weu(s0, w0), wex(s0, wn(w0)), wex(hs0, wal(s0, wb(w0, wceq(cv(s0), cv(hs0))))), wn(wal(s0, w0)))
  exlimiv(hs0, wal(s0, wb(w0, wceq(cv(s0), cv(hs0)))), wn(wal(s0, w0)))
  mtbiri(wal(s0, wb(w0, wceq(cv(s0), cv(hs0)))), wal(s0, w0), wal(s0, wceq(cv(s0), cv(hs0))))
  dtru(s0, hs0)
  albi(s0, w0, wceq(cv(s0), cv(hs0)))
  eu6(s0, hs0, w0)
  exnal(s0, w0)
  diff.hs0.w(wn(wal(s0, w0)))
  diffss.ex(s0, hs0)
  diff.hs0.s(s0)
  diff.hs0.w(w0)
}

blocks.name: eusv1
blocks.content: Two ways to express single-valuedness of a class expression ` A ( x ) ` . (Contributed by NM, 14-Oct-2010.)
blocks.origin:
thm eusv1(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0) {
  |- wb(weu(s0, wal(s1, wceq(cv(s0), c0))), wex(s0, wal(s1, wceq(cv(s0), c0))))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
} = {
  mpbiran2(weu(s0, wal(s1, wceq(cv(s0), c0))), wex(s0, wal(s1, wceq(cv(s0), c0))), wal(s0, wal(hs0, wi(wa(wal(s1, wceq(cv(s0), c0)), wal(s1, wceq(cv(hs0), c0))), wceq(cv(s0), cv(hs0))))))
  gen2(s0, hs0, wi(wa(wal(s1, wceq(cv(s0), c0)), wal(s1, wceq(cv(hs0), c0))), wceq(cv(s0), cv(hs0))))
  syl2an(wal(s1, wceq(cv(s0), c0)), wal(s1, wceq(cv(hs0), c0)), wceq(cv(s0), cv(hs0)), wceq(cv(s0), c0), wceq(cv(hs0), c0))
  sp(s1, wceq(cv(s0), c0))
  sp(s1, wceq(cv(hs0), c0))
  eqtr3(cv(s0), c0, cv(hs0))
  eu4(s0, hs0, wal(s1, wceq(cv(s0), c0)), wal(s1, wceq(cv(hs0), c0)))
  albidv(s1, wceq(cv(s0), cv(hs0)), wceq(cv(s0), c0), wceq(cv(hs0), c0))
  eqeq1(cv(s0), cv(hs0), c0)
  diff.wal.s(s0, s1, wceq(cv(hs0), c0))
  diff.wceq.s(s0, cv(hs0), c0)
  diff.cv.s(s0, hs0)
  diffss.ex(s0, hs0)
  diff.hs0.s(s0)
  diff.hs0.w(wal(s1, wceq(cv(s0), c0)))
  diff.wceq.s(s1, cv(s0), cv(hs0))
  diff.cv.s(s1, s0)
  diffss.ex(s1, s0)
  diff.cv.s(s1, hs0)
  diffss.ex(s1, hs0)
  diff.hs0.s(s1)
}

blocks.name: eusvnf
blocks.content: Even if ` x ` is free in ` A ` , it is effectively bound when ` A ( x ) ` is single-valued. (Contributed by NM, 14-Oct-2010.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 14-Oct-2016.)
blocks.origin:
thm eusvnf(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0) {
  |- wi(weu(s0, wal(s1, wceq(cv(s0), c0))), wnfc(s1, c0))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
} = {
  syl(weu(s0, wal(s1, wceq(cv(s0), c0))), wnfc(s1, c0), wex(s0, wal(s1, wceq(cv(s0), c0))))
  euex(s0, wal(s1, wceq(cv(s0), c0)))
  exlimiv(s0, wal(s1, wceq(cv(s0), c0)), wnfc(s1, c0))
  sylibr(wal(s1, wceq(cv(s0), c0)), wnfc(s1, c0), wal(hs0, wal(hs1, wceq(csb(s1, cv(hs0), c0), csb(s1, cv(hs1), c0)))))
  alrimivv(hs0, hs1, wal(s1, wceq(cv(s0), c0)), wceq(csb(s1, cv(hs0), c0), csb(s1, cv(hs1), c0)))
  eqtr3d(csb(s1, cv(hs0), c0), csb(s1, cv(hs1), c0), cv(s0), wal(s1, wceq(cv(s0), c0)))
  elv(hs0, wi(wal(s1, wceq(cv(s0), c0)), wceq(cv(s0), csb(s1, cv(hs0), c0))))
  spcgf(s1, cv(hs0), universe, wceq(cv(s0), c0), wceq(cv(s0), csb(s1, cv(hs0), c0)))
  nfcv(s1, cv(hs0))
  nfeq2(s1, cv(s0), csb(s1, cv(hs0), c0))
  nfcsb1v(s1, cv(hs0), c0)
  eqeq2d(cv(s0), c0, csb(s1, cv(hs0), c0), wceq(cv(s1), cv(hs0)))
  csbeq1a(s1, cv(hs0), c0)
  elv(hs1, wi(wal(s1, wceq(cv(s0), c0)), wceq(cv(s0), csb(s1, cv(hs1), c0))))
  spcgf(s1, cv(hs1), universe, wceq(cv(s0), c0), wceq(cv(s0), csb(s1, cv(hs1), c0)))
  nfcv(s1, cv(hs1))
  nfeq2(s1, cv(s0), csb(s1, cv(hs1), c0))
  nfcsb1v(s1, cv(hs1), c0)
  eqeq2d(cv(s0), c0, csb(s1, cv(hs1), c0), wceq(cv(s1), cv(hs1)))
  csbeq1a(s1, cv(hs1), c0)
  sbnfc2(s1, hs0, hs1, c0)
  diff.wnfc.s(s0, s1, c0)
  diff.hs0.w(wal(s1, wceq(cv(s0), c0)))
  diff.hs1.w(wal(s1, wceq(cv(s0), c0)))
  diff.cv.s(s1, hs0)
  diff.cv.s(s1, s0)
  diffss.ex(s1, s0)
  diff.cv.s(s1, hs1)
  diffss.ex(s1, hs0)
  diff.hs0.s(s1)
  diffss.ex(s1, hs1)
  diff.hs1.s(s1)
  diff.hs0.s(hs1)
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs1.c(c0)
}

blocks.name: eusvnfb
blocks.content: Two ways to say that ` A ( x ) ` is a set expression that does not depend on ` x ` . (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 18-Nov-2016.)
blocks.origin:
thm eusvnfb(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0) {
  |- wb(weu(s0, wal(s1, wceq(cv(s0), c0))), wa(wnfc(s1, c0), wcel(c0, universe)))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
} = {
  impbii(weu(s0, wal(s1, wceq(cv(s0), c0))), wa(wnfc(s1, c0), wcel(c0, universe)))
  jca(weu(s0, wal(s1, wceq(cv(s0), c0))), wnfc(s1, c0), wcel(c0, universe))
  eusvnf(s0, s1, c0)
  syl(weu(s0, wal(s1, wceq(cv(s0), c0))), wcel(c0, universe), wex(s0, wal(s1, wceq(cv(s0), c0))))
  euex(s0, wal(s1, wceq(cv(s0), c0)))
  exlimiv(s0, wal(s1, wceq(cv(s0), c0)), wcel(c0, universe))
  sps(s1, wceq(cv(s0), c0), wcel(c0, universe))
  eqvisset(s0, c0)
  sylibr(wa(wnfc(s1, c0), wcel(c0, universe)), weu(s0, wal(s1, wceq(cv(s0), c0))), wex(s0, wal(s1, wceq(cv(s0), c0))))
  imp(wnfc(s1, c0), wcel(c0, universe), wex(s0, wal(s1, wceq(cv(s0), c0))))
  syl5bi(wnfc(s1, c0), wcel(c0, universe), wex(s0, wal(s1, wceq(cv(s0), c0))), wex(s0, wceq(cv(s0), c0)))
  isset(s0, c0)
  eximdv(s0, wnfc(s1, c0), wceq(cv(s0), c0), wal(s1, wceq(cv(s0), c0)))
  nf5rd(s1, wnfc(s1, c0), wceq(cv(s0), c0))
  nfeqd(s1, cv(s0), c0, wnfc(s1, c0))
  nfcvd(s1, cv(s0), wnfc(s1, c0))
  id(wnfc(s1, c0))
  eusv1(s0, s1, c0)
  diff.wcel.s(s0, c0, universe)
  diff.universe.s(s0)
  diff.wnfc.s(s0, s1, c0)
  diff.cv.s(s1, s0)
  diffss.ex(s1, s0)
}

blocks.name: reusv2
blocks.content: Two ways to express single-valuedness of a class expression ` C ( y ) ` that is constant for those ` y e. B ` such that ` ph ` . The first antecedent ensures that the constant value belongs to the existential uniqueness domain ` A ` , and the second ensures that ` C ( y ) ` is evaluated for at least one ` y ` . (Contributed by NM, 4-Jan-2013.) (Proof shortened by Mario Carneiro, 19-Nov-2016.)
blocks.origin:
thm reusv2(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, class c1, class c2, wff w0) {
  |- wi(wa(wral(s0, c0, wi(w0, wcel(c1, c2))), wrex(s0, c0, w0)), wb(wreu(s1, c2, wrex(s0, c0, wa(w0, wceq(cv(s1), c1)))), wreu(s1, c2, wral(s0, c0, wi(w0, wceq(cv(s1), c1))))))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c2)
  -| diffsc(s1, c0)
  -| diffsc(s1, c1)
  -| diffsc(s1, c2)
  -| diffsw(s1, w0)
} = {
  syl2anbr(wral(s0, c0, wi(w0, wcel(c1, c2))), wrex(s0, c0, w0), wb(wreu(s1, c2, wrex(s0, c0, wa(w0, wceq(cv(s1), c1)))), wreu(s1, c2, wral(s0, c0, wi(w0, wceq(cv(s1), c1))))), wral(hs0, crab(s0, c0, w0), wcel(csb(s0, cv(hs0), c1), c2)), wne(crab(s0, c0, w0), emptycls))
  bitr3i(wral(hs0, crab(s0, c0, w0), wcel(csb(s0, cv(hs0), c1), c2)), wral(s0, c0, wi(w0, wcel(c1, c2))), wral(s0, crab(s0, c0, w0), wcel(c1, c2)))
  cbvralf(s0, hs0, crab(s0, c0, w0), wcel(c1, c2), wcel(csb(s0, cv(hs0), c1), c2))
  nfv(hs0, wcel(c1, c2))
  nfel1(s0, csb(s0, cv(hs0), c1), c2)
  eleq1d(c1, c2, csb(s0, cv(hs0), c1), wceq(cv(s0), cv(hs0)))
  ralbii2(s0, crab(s0, c0, w0), c0, wcel(c1, c2), wi(w0, wcel(c1, c2)))
  bitri(wi(wcel(cv(s0), crab(s0, c0, w0)), wcel(c1, c2)), wi(wcel(cv(s0), c0), wi(w0, wcel(c1, c2))), wi(wa(wcel(cv(s0), c0), w0), wcel(c1, c2)))

blocks.name: alxfr
blocks.content: Transfer universal quantification from a variable ` x ` to another variable ` y ` contained in expression ` A ` . (Contributed by NM, 18-Feb-2007.)

thm alxfr(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, class c1, wff w0, wff w1) {
  |- wi(wa(wal(s0, wcel(c0, c1)), wal(s1, wex(s0, wceq(cv(s1), c0)))), wb(wal(s1, w0), wal(s0, w1)))
  -| wi(wceq(cv(s1), c0), wb(w0, w1))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffsc(s1, c0)
  -| diffsw(s0, w0)
  -| diffsw(s1, w1)
} = {
  impbid(wa(wal(s0, wcel(c0, c1)), wal(s1, wex(s0, wceq(cv(s1), c0)))), wal(s1, w0), wal(s0, w1))
  adantr(wal(s0, wcel(c0, c1)), wal(s1, wex(s0, wceq(cv(s1), c0))), wi(wal(s1, w0), wal(s0, w1)))
  com12(wal(s0, wcel(c0, c1)), wal(s1, w0), wal(s0, w1))
  alimdv(s0, wal(s1, w0), wcel(c0, c1), w1)
  com12(wal(s1, w0), wcel(c0, c1), w1)
  spcgv(s1, c0, c1, w0, w1)
  adantl(wal(s0, wcel(c0, c1)), wal(s1, wex(s0, wceq(cv(s1), c0))), wi(wal(s0, w1), wal(s1, w0)))
  com12(wal(s1, wex(s0, wceq(cv(s1), c0))), wal(s0, w1), wal(s1, w0))
  alimdv(s1, wal(s0, w1), wex(s0, wceq(cv(s1), c0)), w0)
  exlimd(s0, wal(s0, w1), wceq(cv(s1), c0), w0)
  nfa1(s0, w1)
  nfv(s0, w0)
  syl5ibrcom(wal(s0, w1), wceq(cv(s1), c0), w0, w1)
  sp(s0, w1)
  diff.wal.s(s0, s1, w0)
  diff.wal.s(s1, s0, w1)
  diffss.ex(s1, s0)
}

thm rabxfr(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, wff w0, wff w1) {

thm reuxfrd(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, class c1, wff w0, wff w1, wff w2) {
  |- wi(w0, wb(wreu(s0, c0, w1), wreu(s1, c0, w2)))
  -| wi(wa(w0, wcel(cv(s1), c0)), wcel(c1, c0))
  -| wi(wa(w0, wcel(cv(s0), c0)), wreu(s1, c0, wceq(cv(s0), c1)))
  -| wi(wceq(cv(s0), c1), wb(w1, w2))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s0, c1)
  -| diffsc(s1, c0)
  -| diffsw(s0, w0)
  -| diffsw(s0, w2)
  -| diffsw(s1, w0)
  -| diffsw(s1, w1)
} = {
  bitrd(w0, wreu(s0, c0, w1), wreu(s1, c0, w2), wreu(s0, c0, wrex(s1, c0, wa(wceq(cv(s0), c1), w2))))

  syl6bb(wa(w0, wcel(cv(s0), c0)), w1, wrex(s1, c0, wa(wceq(cv(s0), c1), w2)), wa(wrex(s1, c0, wceq(cv(s0), c1)), w1))
  biantrurd(wa(w0, wcel(cv(s0), c0)), w1, wrex(s1, c0, wceq(cv(s0), c1)))
  syl(wa(w0, wcel(cv(s0), c0)), wrex(s1, c0, wceq(cv(s0), c1)), wreu(s1, c0, wceq(cv(s0), c1)))
  reurex(s1, c0, wceq(cv(s0), c1))
  bitr3i(wa(wrex(s1, c0, wceq(cv(s0), c1)), w1), wrex(s1, c0, wa(wceq(cv(s0), c1), w2)), wrex(s1, c0, wa(wceq(cv(s0), c1), w1)))
  r19.41v(s1, c0, wceq(cv(s0), c1), w1)
  rexbii(s1, c0, wa(wceq(cv(s0), c1), w1), wa(wceq(cv(s0), c1), w2))
  pm5.32i(wceq(cv(s0), c1), w1, w2)
  reuxfr3d(s0, s1, c0, c0, c1, w0, w2)
  syl(wa(w0, wcel(cv(s0), c0)), wrmo(s1, c0, wceq(cv(s0), c1)), wreu(s1, c0, wceq(cv(s0), c1)))
  reurmo(s1, c0, wceq(cv(s0), c1))
}

  âŠ¢ (w0 â†’(âˆƒ!(s0 âˆˆ c0, w1)â†” âˆƒ!(s1 âˆˆ c0, w2)))
  âŠ£ ((w0 âˆ§ s1 âˆˆ c0)â†’ c1 âˆˆ c0)

blocks.content: A theorem useful for eliminating the restricted existential uniqueness hypotheses in ~ riotaxfrd . (Contributed by NM, 16-Jan-2012.)
blocks.origin:
thm reuhypd(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, class c1, class c2, wff w0) {
  |- wi(wa(w0, wcel(cv(s0), c0)), wreu(s1, c0, wceq(cv(s0), c1)))
  -| wi(wa(w0, wcel(cv(s0), c0)), wcel(c2, c0))
  -| wi(w3a(w0, wcel(cv(s0), c0), wcel(cv(s1), c0)), wb(wceq(cv(s0), c1), wceq(cv(s1), c2)))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffsc(s1, c0)
  -| diffsc(s1, c2)
  -| diffsw(s1, w0)
} = {
  sylibr(wa(w0, wcel(cv(s0), c0)), wreu(s1, c0, wceq(cv(s0), c1)), weu(s1, wa(wcel(cv(s1), c0), wceq(cv(s0), c1))))
  mpbid(wa(w0, wcel(cv(s0), c0)), weu(s1, wa(wcel(cv(s1), c0), wceq(cv(s0), c1))), weu(s1, wceq(cv(s1), c2)))
  sylib(wa(w0, wcel(cv(s0), c0)), weu(s1, wceq(cv(s1), c2)), wcel(c2, universe))
  elexd(c2, c0, wa(w0, wcel(cv(s0), c0)))
  eueq(s1, c2)
  eubidv(s1, wa(w0, wcel(cv(s0), c0)), wceq(cv(s1), c2), wa(wcel(cv(s1), c0), wceq(cv(s0), c1)))
  bitr4d(wa(w0, wcel(cv(s0), c0)), wceq(cv(s1), c2), wa(wcel(cv(s1), c0), wceq(cv(s0), c1)), wa(wcel(cv(s1), c0), wceq(cv(s1), c2)))
  pm4.71rd(wa(w0, wcel(cv(s0), c0)), wceq(cv(s1), c2), wcel(cv(s1), c0))
  syl5ibrcom(wa(w0, wcel(cv(s0), c0)), wceq(cv(s1), c2), wcel(cv(s1), c0), wcel(c2, c0))
  eleq1(cv(s1), c2, c0)
  pm5.32da(wa(w0, wcel(cv(s0), c0)), wcel(cv(s1), c0), wceq(cv(s0), c1), wceq(cv(s1), c2))
  3expa(w0, wcel(cv(s0), c0), wcel(cv(s1), c0), wb(wceq(cv(s0), c1), wceq(cv(s1), c2)))
  df-reu(s1, c0, wceq(cv(s0), c1))
  diff.wa.s(s1, w0, wcel(cv(s0), c0))
  diff.wcel.s(s1, cv(s0), c0)
  diff.cv.s(s1, s0)
  diffss.ex(s1, s0)
}

thm reuhyp(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, class c1, class c2) {
  |- wi(wcel(cv(s0), c0), wreu(s1, c0, wceq(cv(s0), c1)))
  -| wi(wcel(cv(s0), c0), wcel(c2, c0))
  -| wi(wa(wcel(cv(s0), c0), wcel(cv(s1), c0)), wb(wceq(cv(s0), c1), wceq(cv(s1), c2)))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)

  -| diffsc(s1, c2)
} = {
  mpan(wcel(cv(s0), c0), wreu(s1, c0, wceq(cv(s0), c1)), wtru)
  tru()
  reuhypd(s0, s1, c0, c1, c2, wtru)
  adantl(wtru, wcel(cv(s0), c0), wcel(c2, c0))
  3adant1(wtru, wcel(cv(s0), c0), wcel(cv(s1), c0), wb(wceq(cv(s0), c1), wceq(cv(s1), c2)))
  diff.wtru.s(s1)
}

  âŠ£ ((s0 âˆˆ c0 âˆ§ s1 âˆˆ c0)â†’(s0 = c1 â†” s1 = c2))
  âŠ£ d(s0, s1)
  âŠ£ d(s1, c0)
  âŠ£ d(s1, c2)
} = {
  mpan(s0 âˆˆ c0, âˆƒ!(s1 âˆˆ c0, s0 = c1), wtru)
  tru()
  reuhypd(s0, s1, c0, c1, c2, wtru)
  adantl(wtru, s0 âˆˆ c0, c2 âˆˆ c0)
  3adant1(wtru, s0 âˆˆ c0, s1 âˆˆ c0, (s0 = c1 â†” s1 = c2))
  diff.wtru.s(s1)
}

blocks.name: zfpair
blocks.content: The Axiom of Pairing of Zermelo-Fraenkel set theory. Axiom 2 of [TakeutiZaring] p. 15. In some textbooks this is stated as a separate axiom; here we show it is redundant since it can be derived from the other axioms. This theorem should not be referenced by any proof other than ~ axprALT . Instead, use ~ zfpair2 below so that the uses of the Axiom of Pairing can be more easily identified. (Contributed by NM, 18-Oct-1995.) (New usage is discouraged.)
blocks.origin:
thm zfpair(setvar s0, setvar s1) {
  |- wcel(cpr(cv(s0), cv(s1)), universe)
} = {
  eqeltri(cpr(cv(s0), cv(s1)), universe, cab(hs0, wo(wceq(cv(hs0), cv(s0)), wceq(cv(hs0), cv(s1)))))
  dfpr2(hs0, cv(s0), cv(s1))
  eqeltri(cab(hs0, wo(wceq(cv(hs0), cv(s0)), wceq(cv(hs0), cv(s1)))), universe, cab(hs0, wex(hs1, wa(wo(wceq(cv(hs1), emptycls), wceq(cv(hs1), csn(emptycls))), wo(wa(wceq(cv(hs1), emptycls), wceq(cv(hs0), cv(s0))), wa(wceq(cv(hs1), csn(emptycls)), wceq(cv(hs0), cv(s1))))))))
  abbii(hs0, wo(wceq(cv(hs0), cv(s0)), wceq(cv(hs0), cv(s1))), wex(hs1, wa(wo(wceq(cv(hs1), emptycls), wceq(cv(hs1), csn(emptycls))), wo(wa(wceq(cv(hs1), emptycls), wceq(cv(hs0), cv(s0))), wa(wceq(cv(hs1), csn(emptycls)), wceq(cv(hs0), cv(s1)))))))
  3bitr3ri(wo(wceq(cv(hs0), cv(s0)), wceq(cv(hs0), cv(s1))), wex(hs1, wa(wo(wceq(cv(hs1), emptycls), wceq(cv(hs1), csn(emptycls))), wo(wa(wceq(cv(hs1), emptycls), wceq(cv(hs0), cv(s0))), wa(wceq(cv(hs1), csn(emptycls)), wceq(cv(hs0), cv(s1)))))), wex(hs1, wo(wa(wceq(cv(hs1), emptycls), wceq(cv(hs0), cv(s0))), wa(wceq(cv(hs1), csn(emptycls)), wceq(cv(hs0), cv(s1))))), wo(wex(hs1, wa(wceq(cv(hs1), emptycls), wceq(cv(hs0), cv(s0)))), wex(hs1, wa(wceq(cv(hs1), csn(emptycls)), wceq(cv(hs0), cv(s1))))))
  19.43(hs1, wa(wceq(cv(hs1), emptycls), wceq(cv(hs0), cv(s0))), wa(wceq(cv(hs1), csn(emptycls)), wceq(cv(hs0), cv(s1))))
  exbii(hs1, wo(wa(wceq(cv(hs1), emptycls), wceq(cv(hs0), cv(s0))), wa(wceq(cv(hs1), csn(emptycls)), wceq(cv(hs0), cv(s1)))), wa(wo(wceq(cv(hs1), emptycls), wceq(cv(hs1), csn(emptycls))), wo(wa(wceq(cv(hs1), emptycls), wceq(cv(hs0), cv(s0))), wa(wceq(cv(hs1), csn(emptycls)), wceq(cv(hs0), cv(s1))))))
  prlem2(wceq(cv(hs1), emptycls), wceq(cv(hs0), cv(s0)), wceq(cv(hs1), csn(emptycls)), wceq(cv(hs0), cv(s1)))
  orbi12i(wex(hs1, wa(wceq(cv(hs1), emptycls), wceq(cv(hs0), cv(s0)))), wex(hs1, wa(wceq(cv(hs1), csn(emptycls)), wceq(cv(hs0), cv(s1)))), wceq(cv(hs0), cv(s0)), wceq(cv(hs0), cv(s1)))
  mpbiran(wex(hs1, wa(wceq(cv(hs1), emptycls), wceq(cv(hs0), cv(s0)))), wceq(cv(hs0), cv(s0)), wex(hs1, wceq(cv(hs1), emptycls)))
  isseti(hs1, emptycls)
  0ex()
  19.41v(hs1, wceq(cv(hs1), emptycls), wceq(cv(hs0), cv(s0)))
  mpbiran(wex(hs1, wa(wceq(cv(hs1), csn(emptycls)), wceq(cv(hs0), cv(s1)))), wceq(cv(hs0), cv(s1)), wex(hs1, wceq(cv(hs1), csn(emptycls))))
  isseti(hs1, csn(emptycls))
  p0ex()
  19.41v(hs1, wceq(cv(hs1), csn(emptycls)), wceq(cv(hs0), cv(s1)))
  zfrep4(hs0, hs1, hs2, wo(wceq(cv(hs1), emptycls), wceq(cv(hs1), csn(emptycls))), wo(wa(wceq(cv(hs1), emptycls), wceq(cv(hs0), cv(s0))), wa(wceq(cv(hs1), csn(emptycls)), wceq(cv(hs0), cv(s1)))))
  eqeltrri(cab(hs1, wo(wceq(cv(hs1), emptycls), wceq(cv(hs1), csn(emptycls)))), universe, cpr(emptycls, csn(emptycls)))
  dfpr2(hs1, emptycls, csn(emptycls))
  pp0ex()
  jaoi(wceq(cv(hs1), emptycls), wceq(cv(hs1), csn(emptycls)), wex(hs2, wal(hs0, wi(wo(wa(wceq(cv(hs1), emptycls), wceq(cv(hs0), cv(s0))), wa(wceq(cv(hs1), csn(emptycls)), wceq(cv(hs0), cv(s1)))), wceq(cv(hs0), cv(hs2))))))
  spimev(hs2, s0, wceq(cv(hs1), emptycls), wal(hs0, wi(wo(wa(wceq(cv(hs1), emptycls), wceq(cv(hs0), cv(s0))), wa(wceq(cv(hs1), csn(emptycls)), wceq(cv(hs0), cv(s1)))), wceq(cv(hs0), cv(hs2)))))
  alrimdv(hs0, wceq(cv(hs2), cv(s0)), wceq(cv(hs1), emptycls), wi(wo(wa(wceq(cv(hs1), emptycls), wceq(cv(hs0), cv(s0))), wa(wceq(cv(hs1), csn(emptycls)), wceq(cv(hs0), cv(s1)))), wceq(cv(hs0), cv(hs2))))
  prlem1(wceq(cv(hs2), cv(s0)), wceq(cv(hs1), emptycls), wceq(cv(hs0), cv(s0)), wceq(cv(hs1), csn(emptycls)), wceq(cv(hs0), cv(s1)), wceq(cv(hs0), cv(hs2)))
  equequ2(hs2, s0, hs0)
  spimev(hs2, s1, wceq(cv(hs1), csn(emptycls)), wal(hs0, wi(wo(wa(wceq(cv(hs1), emptycls), wceq(cv(hs0), cv(s0))), wa(wceq(cv(hs1), csn(emptycls)), wceq(cv(hs0), cv(s1)))), wceq(cv(hs0), cv(hs2)))))
  alrimdv(hs0, wceq(cv(hs2), cv(s1)), wceq(cv(hs1), csn(emptycls)), wi(wo(wa(wceq(cv(hs1), emptycls), wceq(cv(hs0), cv(s0))), wa(wceq(cv(hs1), csn(emptycls)), wceq(cv(hs0), cv(s1)))), wceq(cv(hs0), cv(hs2))))
  syl7bi(wceq(cv(hs2), cv(s1)), wceq(cv(hs1), csn(emptycls)), wo(wa(wceq(cv(hs1), emptycls), wceq(cv(hs0), cv(s0))), wa(wceq(cv(hs1), csn(emptycls)), wceq(cv(hs0), cv(s1)))), wceq(cv(hs0), cv(hs2)), wo(wa(wceq(cv(hs1), csn(emptycls)), wceq(cv(hs0), cv(s1))), wa(wceq(cv(hs1), emptycls), wceq(cv(hs0), cv(s0)))))
  orcom(wa(wceq(cv(hs1), emptycls), wceq(cv(hs0), cv(s0))), wa(wceq(cv(hs1), csn(emptycls)), wceq(cv(hs0), cv(s1))))
  prlem1(wceq(cv(hs2), cv(s1)), wceq(cv(hs1), csn(emptycls)), wceq(cv(hs0), cv(s1)), wceq(cv(hs1), emptycls), wceq(cv(hs0), cv(s0)), wceq(cv(hs0), cv(hs2)))
  equequ2(hs2, s1, hs0)
  con2i(wceq(cv(hs1), csn(emptycls)), wceq(cv(hs1), emptycls))
  0inp0(cv(hs1))
  diff.hs0.c(cv(s0))
  diff.hs0.c(cv(s1))
  diff.hs1.c(emptycls)
  diff.hs1.w(wceq(cv(hs0), cv(s0)))
  diff.hs1.c(csn(emptycls))
  diff.hs1.w(wceq(cv(hs0), cv(s1)))
  diff.hs0.s(hs1)
  diff.hs0.s(hs2)
  diff.hs1.s(hs2)
  diff.hs0.w(wo(wceq(cv(hs1), emptycls), wceq(cv(hs1), csn(emptycls))))
  diff.hs2.w(wo(wceq(cv(hs1), emptycls), wceq(cv(hs1), csn(emptycls))))
  diff.hs2.w(wo(wa(wceq(cv(hs1), emptycls), wceq(cv(hs0), cv(s0))), wa(wceq(cv(hs1), csn(emptycls)), wceq(cv(hs0), cv(s1)))))
  diff.hs2.w(wceq(cv(hs1), emptycls))
  diff.hs0.w(wceq(cv(hs2), cv(s0)))
  diff.hs0.w(wceq(cv(hs1), emptycls))
  diff.hs2.w(wceq(cv(hs1), csn(emptycls)))
  diff.hs0.w(wceq(cv(hs2), cv(s1)))
  diff.hs0.w(wceq(cv(hs1), csn(emptycls)))
}

blocks.name: axprALT
blocks.content: Alternate proof of ~ axpr . (Contributed by NM, 14-Nov-2006.) (New usage is discouraged.) (Proof modification is discouraged.)

thm axprALT(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, setvar s3) {
  |- wex(s0, wal(s1, wi(wo(wceq(cv(s1), cv(s2)), wceq(cv(s1), cv(s3))), wcel(cv(s1), cv(s0)))))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffss(s0, s2)
  -| diffss(s0, s3)
  -| diffss(s1, s2)
  -| diffss(s1, s3)
} = {
  eximii(s0, wal(s1, wi(wo(wceq(cv(s1), cv(s2)), wceq(cv(s1), cv(s3))), wcel(cv(s1), cv(s0)))), wceq(cv(s0), cpr(cv(s2), cv(s3))))
  isseti(s0, cpr(cv(s2), cv(s3)))
  zfpair(s2, s3)
  sylbi(wceq(cv(s0), cpr(cv(s2), cv(s3))), wal(s1, wi(wo(wceq(cv(s1), cv(s2)), wceq(cv(s1), cv(s3))), wcel(cv(s1), cv(s0)))), wal(s1, wb(wcel(cv(s1), cv(s0)), wcel(cv(s1), cpr(cv(s2), cv(s3))))))
  dfcleq(s1, cv(s0), cpr(cv(s2), cv(s3)))
  alimi(s1, wb(wcel(cv(s1), cv(s0)), wcel(cv(s1), cpr(cv(s2), cv(s3)))), wi(wo(wceq(cv(s1), cv(s2)), wceq(cv(s1), cv(s3))), wcel(cv(s1), cv(s0))))
  sylbi(wb(wcel(cv(s1), cv(s0)), wcel(cv(s1), cpr(cv(s2), cv(s3)))), wi(wo(wceq(cv(s1), cv(s2)), wceq(cv(s1), cv(s3))), wcel(cv(s1), cv(s0))), wb(wcel(cv(s1), cv(s0)), wo(wceq(cv(s1), cv(s2)), wceq(cv(s1), cv(s3)))))
  bibi2i(wcel(cv(s1), cv(s0)), wcel(cv(s1), cpr(cv(s2), cv(s3))), wo(wceq(cv(s1), cv(s2)), wceq(cv(s1), cv(s3))))
  elpr(cv(s1), cv(s2), cv(s3))
  vex(s1)
  biimpr(wcel(cv(s1), cv(s0)), wo(wceq(cv(s1), cv(s2)), wceq(cv(s1), cv(s3))))
  diff.cpr.s(s0, cv(s2), cv(s3))
  diff.cv.s(s0, s2)
  diff.cv.s(s0, s3)
  diff.cv.s(s1, s0)
  diffss.ex(s1, s0)
  diff.cpr.s(s1, cv(s2), cv(s3))
  diff.cv.s(s1, s2)
  diff.cv.s(s1, s3)
}
